text: Rathgormack () is a village and parish in northern County Waterford, Ireland. ==Amenities== Rathgormuck's Roman Catholic church The village has a pub, a shop, a newly made all-weather pitch, a recreational park, a national school and a Roman Catholic Church. ==Geography== The closest centres of population to Rathgormack are the County Tipperary towns of Carrick-on-Suir and Clonmel. It is the twin parish of Clonea-Power. The population of the area is around 1200. Farming and agriculture-related industries are the main sources of employment. Tourism is also important, with a hiking centre located in the village. It caters mainly for hikers to the nearby Comeragh Mountains. The town is overlooked by Cruachan Paorach.http://www.hill- bagging.co.uk/mountaindetails.php?rf=20370 == History == In 1921, during the Irish War of Independence, a District Inspector of the Royal Irish Constabulary, Gilbert Potter was executed by Dinny Lacey of the Third Tipperary Brigade of the Irish Republican Army (IRA) on the banks of the River Clodagh, about 1 km south of the village. ==See also== * List of towns and villages in Ireland ==References== ==External links== *Rathgormack National School Category:Towns and villages in County Waterford
title: Rathgormack
